website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice in a combo-washer dryer that is very energy efficient.
pros: This model stands out for being economical in terms of energy and water usage
Users appreciate that it cleans and dries well with a compact design
It also offers a good variety of washing and drying options for the price
cons: On occasion consumers report issues with the machine not working or leaking, and some feel it didn't clean soiled loads perfectly the first time
Dry time is also longer than standard models

customer_reviews.title: space saver
customer_reviews.text: Washes quite well, takes little space which is what I needed. Drying not so good.
customer_reviews.author: Marlybell

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage product with garbage customer recovery
customer_reviews.text: In May we acquired this unit then on May 30th later it stopped drying with an error code. Haier sent some repair tech who in turn electrocuted himself while he was working on it when it was running. Then the unit turned off completely and now I can't even wash my clothes. They said parts would arrive in two weeks. After 3 calls of rescheduling because parts are on backorder. It is now July 10th and no parts or any repairs have been completed. Do not buy from Haier. Absolute garbage product with garbage customer recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Ban together for a class action suit against this company
customer_reviews.text: Just another broken record here; I live on a military base in Maryland where I was trying to have my own washer and dryer to avoid using the RV Park community service and thought I procured the solution.....I was wrong, within 2-3 months I got the FC code of death and now my clothes are locked inside...Who designs something that poorly? Why create something so overly complicated that simply washes and drys clothes? Seriously, how do we band together and file a formal complaint against the company to make their wrong in to a right? People have spent their hard earned money on this product to simply be taken to the cleaners! literally!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: It washes okay buy doesn't dry worth a damn. Won't let you stop it once it's in a cycle. I'd never recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Ugh
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: All loads are now taking 5+ hours This unit came with my new apartment and I'm counting down the days until I can switch it out for a stacking unit. One load that only fills the small drum halfway takes over 3.5-4 hours and even then I still have to air dry pieces. RIP you clothes if you forget to take them out immediately as they and the washer will get musty. After I'm done doing two loads of laundry after a full day, I have to leave the door open for hours to let it air out or else it just stays wet in there.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Morgan

customer_reviews.title: What a complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute piece of trash. It takes 6+ hours to dry a SMALL load of cotton t-shirts and socks. We have had a tech out to “fix” it 4 times, and it still doesn’t work properly. I understand it isn’t as fast as a traditional unit, but this is ridiculous. Save your money, it’s faster to wash your clothes by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sean King

customer_reviews.title: Works for about 2 months then will throw codes and breakdown
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy from Amazon, but like the person above - I have to leave a review. This thing is total garbage. I got this machine for my tenants, and within 1 year, we've gone through 4 machines. It will work great for a month or two, then throw an FC code or something similar, and lock your clothes in the machine. Service tells me they wont refund me, instead they'll just replace it with a brand new machine. Been through this process 4 times now. Usually takes 2-3 weeks until my tenants get a new machine. To anyone reading this, i'll save you the frustration we are dealing with.. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Absolute WORST washer/dryer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this washer/dryer combo unit for about 3 months and the door lock gets jammed almost every single time I use it. The only way to reset it that I've found is to run another load and run up my energy bill (which isn't this the problem it's supposed to be solving!?!?!?) Laundry used to take me a few hours a day to complete. It now takes me 12-14 hours just to get through my own individual loads. Absolutely not practical for family use (not even practical for individual use in my opinion). I've never been more frustrated with a piece of equipment in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Worst Washer/Dryer Ever. -1000000000/10
customer_reviews.text: First things first, I didn’t buy this washer/dryer, but it came with the apartment I’m renting. This is the worst washer/dryer I have ever used, EVER. It takes forever to dry clothes, and even when they’re dry, they’re still not really dry after sometimes 5+ hours of drying. It does not matter how small you make your loads, it takes forever. The door will also lock for whatever time it decides to let your clothes “cool down”. I would give this 0 stars if I could. If you are renting like me and see that this washer/dryer comes with your place, don’t bother, purchase your own. I cannot emphasize how horrible it is.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Haier All-In-One HLC1700AXS
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible product. $1,100 from Home Depot. It dries NOTHING and customer service is a waste of time. They want $100 for someone to look at it not including parts and labor. I've done everything I can to get it to work. It washes fine. To dry 1 pair of underwear, 1 pair of socks, a t-shirt and a pair of shorts took 14 hours. 14 hours. I had to use auto dry twice, 2 hour times dry, spin cycle alone 3 times. DO NOT BUY THIS. I even think they stopped making them after 2 years on the market. HORRIBLE PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Rick's Stick

customer_reviews.title: Just use laundromat
customer_reviews.text: Pros: •washing is fairly straightforward Cons: •very small load size •dry time for one load is upwards of three hours •clothes are often not 100% dry But worst of all they come out 10x more wrinkled than were ever possible before. After spending 4 1/2 hours on one load of laundry you end up driving to a laundromat to try to de wrinkle everything.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: SOCIALIZM KILLS
customer_reviews.text: DO TO TO MANY LAWS AND LAWYERS , MASTER SAID THAT CLOTHES MUST TOTALLY COOL OFF BEFORE SLAVE CAN PUT HIS HAND IN THERE SO HE WONT GET HURT SO 4 CIGARETTES LATER IM STILL WAITING FOR THE DOOR TO OPEN AND LET ME IN. THIS VIRGIN WASHER/DRYER IS COMING BACK TO HER PARENTS TOMORROW.
customer_reviews.author: krzysztof welo

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of this brand
customer_reviews.text: Had one for 13 months (one month out of warranty) and it quit working. Haier wouldn't do anything since it was out of warranty. Told us to call a tech. Tech said it would need a new board (circuit I assume) and it would cost almost as much as the machine did. That's just too much money to spend to only last a year. Buyer beware of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: lybell

product_meta.title: Haier, White HLC1700AXW Compact Laundry Combo Washer/Dryer
product_meta.description: Haier HLC1700AXW Compact Laundry Combo Washer/Dryer, White.
feature_bullets: Wash only option ; Adjustable leveling legs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.1 out of 5 stars18 ratings2.1 out of 5 stars
